content:
The question is :

For some prime number p and prime q, let G be group of order p * q, therefore G not a simple group

the math prove follows that:

Sylow theorem Ôºö

Let G G G be a group of order prm p^r mprm, where ppp is prime and p‚à§m p \nmid m p‚à§m. And let P P P is the sylow p- group of G, it satisfy

  1. For i=1,2,‚ãØ‚Äâ,r i = 1,2,\cdots ,r i=1,2,‚ãØ,r , G G G has the subgroup of order pip^ipi
  2. For every sylow p-group , it conjugate with the P P P
  3. If there has e e e sylow p-group, then e e e is factor of ‚à£G‚à£/pr‚à£\mid G\mid /p^r\mid ‚à£G‚à£/pr‚à£ ,and e‚â°1mod‚Äâ‚Äâp e \equiv 1\mod pe‚â°1modp

And there is another lemma is we need :
lemma :

The finite group G G G has only one sylow p-group P P P for prime p p p if and only if P‚ä≤G P \lhd G P‚ä≤G

we can start for this problem .

Prove : We start thinking for the lemma, we need prove the sylow p-group in G G G number is 1.

for sylow theorem , we have subgroup P P P of order p in G G G, now we suppose there are e sylow p-group like P P P , use the sylow theorem, e e e is factor of ‚à£G‚à£/p \mid G\mid / p ‚à£G‚à£/p and e‚â°1mod‚Äâ‚Äâp e \equiv 1\mod pe‚â°1modp, then e=1 e = 1 e=1 or e=q e = q e=q. when e=p e = p e=p , because sylow p-group is maximal subgroup in G, therefore p > q and e‚â°1mod‚Äâ‚Äâp‚áíe=q=kp+1 e \equiv 1 \mod p \Rightarrow e = q = kp+1 e‚â°1modp‚áíe=q=kp+1 is contradiction, so e=1 e = 1 e=1 , use lemma , the P P P is normal subgroup in G G G. Q.E.D.

In lean , the theorem follows that:

example {G: Type} [Group G] [Finite G] {p q: ‚Ñï } [Fact p.Prime][Fact q.Prime] (hg : Nat.card G = p * q): ¬¨(IsSimpleGroup G ) := by  sorry

So , how can use the Proof by contradiction in lean prove this problem.

thanks for everybody

Zhang Qinchuan ÂèëË®ÄÈÅìÔºö

The classification of group of order pq is already formalized:

On github page, they talk about theorem on github is not what i wannt. I think , because I give a converse proposition ( ¬¨(IsSimpleGroup G )). Maybe I can prove it with counterproof

Here's a rather heavy-handed proof:

import Mathlib

theorem solvable_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime {G : Type} [Group G] [Finite G] {p q : ‚Ñï}
    [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime] (hg : Nat.card G = p * q) : IsSolvable G := by
  by_cases hpq : p = q
  ¬∑ rw [hpq, ‚Üê sq] at hg
    let h_commutative : CommGroup G := IsPGroup.commGroupOfCardEqPrimeSq hg
    infer_instance
  ¬∑ suffices h_squarefree : Squarefree (Nat.card G) by
      have h_zgroup : IsZGroup G := IsZGroup.of_squarefree h_squarefree
      infer_instance
    rw [hg, Nat.squarefree_mul_iff, hp.out.coprime_iff_not_dvd, hq.out.dvd_iff_eq hp.out.ne_one, eq_comm,
      Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_primeFactorsList hp.out.ne_zero, Nat.primeFactorsList_prime hp.out,
      Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_primeFactorsList hq.out.ne_zero, Nat.primeFactorsList_prime hq.out]
    exact ‚ü®hpq, List.nodup_singleton p, List.nodup_singleton q‚ü©

theorem not_isSimpleGroup_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime {G : Type} [Group G] [Finite G] {p q : ‚Ñï}
    [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime] (hg : Nat.card G = p * q) : ¬¨ IsSimpleGroup G := by
  intro h_simple
  have h_solvable : IsSolvable G := solvable_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime hg
  rw [‚Üê IsSimpleGroup.comm_iff_isSolvable] at h_solvable
  let h_commutative : CommGroup G := ‚ü®h_solvable‚ü©
  rw [CommGroup.is_simple_iff_isCyclic_and_prime_card, hg, Nat.prime_mul_iff] at h_simple
  simp [hp.out.ne_one, hq.out.ne_one] at h_simple
Marcus has marked this topic as resolved.

Thomas Browning ÂèëË®ÄÈÅìÔºö

Here's a rather heavy-handed proof:

import Mathlib

theorem solvable_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime {G : Type} [Group G] [Finite G] {p q : ‚Ñï}
    [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime] (hg : Nat.card G = p * q) : IsSolvable G := by
  by_cases hpq : p = q
  ¬∑ rw [hpq, ‚Üê sq] at hg
    let h_commutative : CommGroup G := IsPGroup.commGroupOfCardEqPrimeSq hg
    infer_instance
  ¬∑ suffices h_squarefree : Squarefree (Nat.card G) by
      have h_zgroup : IsZGroup G := IsZGroup.of_squarefree h_squarefree
      infer_instance
    rw [hg, Nat.squarefree_mul_iff, hp.out.coprime_iff_not_dvd, hq.out.dvd_iff_eq hp.out.ne_one, eq_comm,
      Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_primeFactorsList hp.out.ne_zero, Nat.primeFactorsList_prime hp.out,
      Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_primeFactorsList hq.out.ne_zero, Nat.primeFactorsList_prime hq.out]
    exact ‚ü®hpq, List.nodup_singleton p, List.nodup_singleton q‚ü©

theorem not_isSimpleGroup_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime {G : Type} [Group G] [Finite G] {p q : ‚Ñï}
    [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime] (hg : Nat.card G = p * q) : ¬¨ IsSimpleGroup G := by
  intro h_simple
  have h_solvable : IsSolvable G := solvable_of_card_eq_prime_mul_prime hg
  rw [‚Üê IsSimpleGroup.comm_iff_isSolvable] at h_solvable
  let h_commutative : CommGroup G := ‚ü®h_solvable‚ü©
  rw [CommGroup.is_simple_iff_isCyclic_and_prime_card, hg, Nat.prime_mul_iff] at h_simple
  simp [hp.out.ne_one, hq.out.ne_one] at h_simple

thank you so much
